title: Instructional Design Workshop for Improving Counting Skills in Three-Year-Old Children

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: A course for professionals in medical, legal, and technical fields to learn strategies for improving 3-year-old children’s counting abilities for job application

learning_goals: Learners can explain educational effectiveness evaluation methods using pre-post test designs.
Learners can develop three or more activities teaching the one-to-one correspondence principle and order irrelevance principle.
Design customized educational strategies considering developmental differences among 3-year-old children
Present at least two types of digital counting education tools utilizing devices (tablets/interactive boards)
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
